div.p: This study was supported by the FY2017 SAKURA Researcher Exchange Program between JSPS and MAEDI. T.I. was supported by the Environment Research and Technology Development Fund (S-14) of the Environmental Restoration and Conservation Agency, Japan. D.D. was supported by the NERC/DFID Future Climate For Africa programme under the AMMA-2050 project, grant number NE/M020126/1. This study utilizes the d4PDF database, which was produced under the SOUSEI programme sponsored by the Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology of Japan. The CYGMA crop model simulations were conducted on the High-Performance Cluster Computing System of the Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries Research Information Technology Center, Ministry of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries of Japan.B.S. and D.D. thank C. Baron and M. Castets (CIRAD, UMR TETIS) for their help in conducting SARRA-H simulations. All authors thank the two anonymous reviewers who significantly improved the clarity and the scientific soundness of this study.
